what: Functions to maintain a bioconductor build report database
title: Functions to maintain a bioconductor build report database
text: package simply provides set tools work Bioconductor build system reports creating structured data reports. Bioconductor build system complex system builds checks Bioconductor packages regular basis. build system produces large set reports build reports packaged report.tgz file. package provides set tools work reports cache locally analysis.

title: Functions to maintain a bioconductor build report database
text: can install development version BiocBuildDB GitHub :

title: Functions to maintain a bioconductor build report database
text: process new build reports (changed since last processing), can use following code: reportdb.csv file exist, created. exist, read updated successfully localizing (copying) new report.tgz files report_dir directory. process_all_new_reports function untar report.tgz file create set tables report directory. tables written files report_dir directory md5 hash report directory prefix. result report_dir directory set csv files containing tables report directories well report.tgz files. Related files named md5 hash prefix report.tgz file. example resulting directory might look like: running , may want sync report_dir directory cloud storage service Amazon S3 Google Cloud Storage safe keeping.
code: library(BiocBuildDB) reportdb_filename = 'reportdb.csv' dir.create('report_dir') process_all_new_reports(reportdb_filename, 'report_dir') -rw-r--r--  1 seandavis  staff   472K Feb  2 11:20 2cc2a659a35d607f71655f3c9c9e4283-build_summary.csv.gz -rw-r--r--  1 seandavis  staff    87K Feb  2 11:20 2cc2a659a35d607f71655f3c9c9e4283-info.csv.gz -rw-r--r--  1 seandavis  staff    37K Feb  2 11:20 2cc2a659a35d607f71655f3c9c9e4283-propagation_status.csv.gz -rw-r--r--  1 seandavis  staff    50M Feb  2 11:18 2cc2a659a35d607f71655f3c9c9e4283-report.tgz -rw-r--r--  1 seandavis  staff   2.9K Feb  2 11:20 2e6b75f554d439ba3dc993e77862a973-build_summary.csv.gz -rw-r--r--  1 seandavis  staff   2.2K Feb  2 11:20 2e6b75f554d439ba3dc993e77862a973-info.csv.gz -rw-r--r--  1 seandavis  staff   514B Feb  2 11:20 2e6b75f554d439ba3dc993e77862a973-propagation_status.csv.gz -rw-r--r--  1 seandavis  staff   202K Feb  2 11:18 2e6b75f554d439ba3dc993e77862a973-report.tgz -rw-r--r--  1 seandavis  staff   497K Feb  2 11:20 354e509ee0e71215f7669fda8bad0246-build_summary.csv.gz -rw-r--r--  1 seandavis  staff    94K Feb  2 11:20 354e509ee0e71215f7669fda8bad0246-info.csv.gz -rw-r--r--  1 seandavis  staff    40K Feb  2 11:20 354e509ee0e71215f7669fda8bad0246-propagation_status.csv.gz -rw-r--r--  1 seandavis  staff    70M Feb  2 11:18 354e509ee0e71215f7669fda8bad0246-report.tgz

what: Work with a report.tgz file (just FYI)
title: Functions to maintain a bioconductor build report database
text: shouldn’t need use functionality directly, show package works example output tables. Show example work report.tgz file. Show first rows table. Present histogram build times (seconds) packages example build report.
code: library(BiocBuildDB) report_tgz <- example_report_tgz() report_dir <- untar_report_tgz(report_tgz) summary_df <- get_build_summary_table(report_dir) info_df <- get_info_table(report_dir) prop_df <- get_propagation_status_table(report_dir) head(summary_df) #> # A tibble: 6 × 9 #>   package     node  stage version status startedat           endedat             #>   <chr>       <chr> <chr> <chr>   <chr>  <dttm>              <dttm>              #> 1 AHCytoBands nebb… buil… 0.99.1  OK     2024-01-17 10:31:13 2024-01-17 10:31:14 #> 2 AHCytoBands nebb… chec… 0.99.1  OK     2024-01-17 10:35:23 2024-01-17 10:35:31 #> 3 AHCytoBands nebb… inst… 0.99.1  OK     2024-01-17 10:30:08 2024-01-17 10:30:11 #> 4 AHEnsDbs    nebb… buil… 1.1.10  OK     2024-01-17 10:31:13 2024-01-17 10:32:01 #> 5 AHEnsDbs    nebb… chec… 1.1.10  OK     2024-01-17 10:35:23 2024-01-17 10:37:24 #> 6 AHEnsDbs    nebb… inst… 1.1.10  OK     2024-01-17 10:30:23 2024-01-17 10:30:49 #> # ℹ 2 more variables: command <chr>, report_md5 <chr> colnames(summary_df) #> [1] "package"    "node"       "stage"      "version"    "status"     #> [6] "startedat"  "endedat"    "command"    "report_md5" head(info_df) #> # A tibble: 6 × 9 #>   Package  Version Maintainer MaintainerEmail git_url git_branch git_last_commit #>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>      <chr>           <chr>   <chr>      <chr>           #> 1 AHCytoB… 0.99.1  Michael L… michafla at ge… https:… RELEASE_3… 821428c         #> 2 AHEnsDbs 1.1.10  Johannes … johannes.raine… https:… RELEASE_3… 1cf652d         #> 3 AHLRBas… 0.99.3  Koki Tsuy… k.t.the-answer… https:… RELEASE_3… c0e6555         #> 4 AHMeSHD… 0.99.6  Koki Tsuy… k.t.the-answer… https:… RELEASE_3… 052e156         #> 5 AHPathb… 0.99.5  Kozo Nish… kozo.nishida a… https:… RELEASE_3… a90bfd4         #> 6 AHPubMe… 0.99.8  Koki Tsuy… k.t.the-answer… https:… RELEASE_3… f43d98f         #> # ℹ 2 more variables: git_last_commit_date <dttm>, report_md5 <chr> colnames(info_df) #> [1] "Package"              "Version"              "Maintainer"           #> [4] "MaintainerEmail"      "git_url"              "git_branch"           #> [7] "git_last_commit"      "git_last_commit_date" "report_md5" head(prop_df) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   package       process propagate                                     report_md5 #>   <chr>         <chr>   <chr>                                         <chr>      #> 1 AHCytoBands   source  UNNEEDED, same version is already published   f8fd2897c… #> 2 AHEnsDbs      source  UNNEEDED, same version is already published   f8fd2897c… #> 3 AHLRBaseDbs   source  NO, version to propagate (0.99.3) is lower t… f8fd2897c… #> 4 AHMeSHDbs     source  NO, version to propagate (0.99.6) is lower t… f8fd2897c… #> 5 AHPathbankDbs source  UNNEEDED, same version is already published   f8fd2897c… #> 6 AHPubMedDbs   source  NO, version to propagate (0.99.8) is lower t… f8fd2897c… colnames(prop_df) #> [1] "package"    "process"    "propagate"  "report_md5" hist(as.numeric(summary_df$endedat - summary_df$startedat))

title: Retrieve all available Bioconductor build system parquet files — get_all_bbs_tables
Retrieve all available Bioconductor build system parquet files — get_all_bbs_tables
text: assign_to_global logical(1) indicating downloaded tables assigned current global environment access. Default FALSE assigned custom environment call get_bbs_table.

title: Retrieve all available Bioconductor build system parquet files — get_all_bbs_tables
text: invisible. tables cached custom environment unless assign_to_global TRUE.

title: Retrieve all available Bioconductor build system parquet files — get_all_bbs_tables
text: function quick wrapper around get_bbs_table download available parquet files tibbles.  default value returned tibbles stored custom environment can easily accessed call get_bbs_table.

title: Retrieve all available Bioconductor build system parquet files — get_all_bbs_tables
text: Lori Shepherd

title: Retrieve all available Bioconductor build system parquet files — get_all_bbs_tables
code: get_all_bbs_tables() #> reading 'build_summary' parquet file... #> reading 'info' parquet file... #> reading 'propagation_status' parquet file...  # Now that all are downloaded. Retrieve cached build_summary tibble build_summary <- get_bbs_table("build_summary") #> Using cached table 'build_summary'  library(stringr) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union # find the times the package BiocFileCache failed on linux nebbiolo builders if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ build_summary |> filter(package == "BiocFileCache", status %in% c("TIMEOUT", "ERROR"), str_starts(node, "nebbiolo"))  } # }

what: Retrieve a remotely read parquet file of Bioconductor build data — get_bbs_table
title: Retrieve a remotely read parquet file of Bioconductor build data — get_bbs_table
text: Bioconductor Build results times cumbersome work interrogate. Parquet files condensed reports provided remotely. functions read remote parquet files using arrow package return tibble. retrieved table stored custom environment easy quick reference either use ad hocly within pre-defined queries provided package.

title: Retrieve a remotely read parquet file of Bioconductor build data — get_bbs_table
Retrieve a remotely read parquet file of Bioconductor build data — get_bbs_table
text: tblname valid parquet file name. Currently available: build_summary, info, propagation_status.

title: Retrieve a remotely read parquet file of Bioconductor build data — get_bbs_table
text: returns tibble.

title: Retrieve a remotely read parquet file of Bioconductor build data — get_bbs_table
text: get_bbs_table returns tibble also saved custom environment quick easy subsequent reference. three tables available can specified get_bbs_table: build_summary, info, propagation_status. build_summary returns tibble results stage Bioconductor build process. info returns tibble information regarding package maintainer git commit status. propagation_status returns tibble data package propagated community.

title: Retrieve a remotely read parquet file of Bioconductor build data — get_bbs_table
text: Lori Shepherd

title: Retrieve a remotely read parquet file of Bioconductor build data — get_bbs_table
code: info <- get_bbs_table("info") #> Using cached table 'info' info #> # A tibble: 1,153,969 × 9 #>    Package Version Maintainer MaintainerEmail git_url git_branch git_last_commit #>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>      <chr>           <chr>   <chr>      <chr>           #>  1 adduct… 1.26.0  Josie Hay… jlhayes1982 at… https:… RELEASE_3… 371b0e2         #>  2 affyco… 1.48.0  Robert D … rshear at ds.d… https:… RELEASE_3… 45dff8f         #>  3 affyda… 1.58.0  Robert D … rshear at ds.d… https:… RELEASE_3… 10b07a5         #>  4 Affyhg… 1.46.0  Zhicheng … zji4 at jhu.edu https:… RELEASE_3… 3087443         #>  5 Affyhg… 1.48.0  Zhicheng … zji4 at jhu.edu https:… RELEASE_3… 404c1b6         #>  6 Affyhg… 1.44.0  Zhicheng … zji4 at jhu.edu https:… RELEASE_3… 2df08dd         #>  7 Affyme… 0.48.0  Henrik Be… henrikb at bra… https:… RELEASE_3… d77ca79         #>  8 Affymo… 1.48.0  Zhicheng … zji4 at jhu.edu https:… RELEASE_3… 53202e1         #>  9 airway  1.30.0  Michael L… michaelisaiahl… https:… RELEASE_3… a6a39c3         #> 10 ALL     1.52.0  Robert Ge… rgentlem at gm… https:… RELEASE_3… 0bc53bb         #> # ℹ 1,153,959 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: git_last_commit_date <dttm>, report_md5 <chr>  library(dplyr) # all the package Lori Shepherd maintains info |> filter(Maintainer == "Lori Shepherd") |> distinct(Package) #> # A tibble: 1 × 1 #>   Package       #>   <chr>         #> 1 BiocFileCache

what: Get the most recent build result data for a given package on a given branch — get_package_build_results
title: Get the most recent build result data for a given package on a given branch — get_package_build_results
text: Get build status information given package specified branch.

title: Get the most recent build result data for a given package on a given branch — get_package_build_results
Get the most recent build result data for a given package on a given branch — get_package_build_results
text: packagename single valid Bioconductor package name branch bioconductor branch (eg. 'devel', 'RELEASE_3_22')

title: Get the most recent build result data for a given package on a given branch — get_package_build_results
text: tibble build status information NULL package branch found

title: Get the most recent build result data for a given package on a given branch — get_package_build_results
text: Utilizes data info build_summary parquet files retrieve latest build results specified package given branch. branch given defaults use 'devel'. data returned includes node (builder machine name), stage (install, build, check), package version number, status stage, date stage completed, git information build (git branch, git commit hash, git commit date).

title: Get the most recent build result data for a given package on a given branch — get_package_build_results
text: Lori Shepherd

Get a count of how many time a package failed on the Bioconductor Build System — package_error_count
text: packagename single valid Bioconductor package name builder name valid Bioconductor build machine (ie 'nebbiolo1') branch bioconductor branch (eg. 'devel', 'RELEASE_3_22')

title: Get a count of how many time a package failed on the Bioconductor Build System — package_error_count
text: tibble data including counts runs errors NULL package found

title: Get a count of how many time a package failed on the Bioconductor Build System — package_error_count
text: Utilizes data build_summary info parquet files retrieve count errors (TIMEOUT/ERROR)  specified package. Optionally given builder machine name Bioconductor branch may specified filter request. builder given return . branch give also return . data returned includes node (builder machine name), package version number, stage (install, build, check), total number times stage/builder tried run, total number times package failed stage, given Bioconductor git branch. NOTE: since 'devel' -going. multiple 'devel' results across multiple years just current devel. See example filtering see recent. NOTE: builder branch found, function continue return unfiltered results.

title: Get a count of how many time a package failed on the Bioconductor Build System — package_error_count
text: Lori Shepherd

ℹ 12 more rows package_error_count("BiocFileCache", builder = "nebbiolo2", branch="RELEASE_3_22") #> # A tibble: 3 × 6 #>   node      version    stage    count_total count_error git_branch   #>   <chr>     <pckg_vrs> <chr>          <int>       <int> <chr>        #> 1 nebbiolo2 3.0.0      buildsrc          27           8 RELEASE_3_22 #> 2 nebbiolo2 3.0.0      checksrc          19           6 RELEASE_3_22 #> 3 nebbiolo2 3.0.0      install           27           0 RELEASE_3_22  library(dplyr) ## devel will have more than just current devel devErrors <- package_error_count("BiocFileCache", branch="devel") ## can use package version number to filter to current devel devErrors |> filter(version == max(version)) #> # what: Get rough timeline overview of package failing events — package_failures_over_time
title: Get rough timeline overview of package failing events — package_failures_over_time

title: Get rough timeline overview of package failing events — package_failures_over_time
Get rough timeline overview of package failing events — package_failures_over_time
text: packagename single valid Bioconductor package name builder name valid Bioconductor build machine (ie 'nebbiolo1') failure_cluster_hours numeric indicating number hours treat failures single event

title: Get rough timeline overview of package failing events — package_failures_over_time
text: tibble failure event information NULL package builder found

title: Get rough timeline overview of package failing events — package_failures_over_time
text: function attempts give overview long package failing given builder. time treat failures single event distinguished consecutive days failure_cluster_hours argument. Currently different cadence builds release compared devel allows flexibility define timeline. use following example interpretation result table: “`   version episode       first_failure        last_failure n_failures 2   3.1.0       3 2025-12-15 02:57:57 2025-12-16 21:29:20          3 3   3.1.0       2 2025-12-13 02:32:33 2025-12-13 02:32:33          1 4   3.1.0       1 2025-12-08 21:30:14 2025-12-11 21:27:29          4              stages statuses 2 buildsrc, checksrc    ERROR 3           checksrc    ERROR 4           buildsrc    ERROR “` package version built build system package 3.1.0. episode refers number failing episodic events. look episode 1, package started failing December 8 continued fail December 11. time period 4 number failures occurred build stage. time last failure first episode second episode December 11 December 13; can infer package built cleanly December 12. episode 2 package failed solely December 13 check stage. Episode 3 began Dec 15 lasted December 16 3 failures occurred either build check stage. hopefully can help determine package failures intermittent long package failing given builder.

title: Get rough timeline overview of package failing events — package_failures_over_time
